headline.seo: On-Screen Abdominals Send India’s Men to Gym
headline.print_headline: A Quest for Six-Packs, Inspired by Bollywood
headline.main: A Quest for Six-Packs, Inspired by Bollywood

docs.abstract: Bollywood's male stars in India are showing off their toned abdominal muscles, a relatively new trend that has become a marker up upward mobility; personal trainers to the stars have become minor celebrities in Mumbai, featured in movie magazines, and fitness centers are filled with aspiring actors and actresses who zealously measure body fat and muscle mass.
docs.lead_paragraph: With almost every Bollywood leading man flaunting beefcake on-screen, fitness centers, once almost nonexistent in India, have quickly multiplied.
docs.snippet: With almost every Bollywood leading man flaunting beefcake on-screen, fitness centers, once almost nonexistent in India, have quickly multiplied.

headline.seo: City Works With Bronx Stores on Offering More Healthful Foods
headline.print_headline: In Bronx, Prime Spot for Healthier Food
headline.main: City Works With Bronx Stores on Offering More Healthful Foods

docs.abstract: New York City Health Dept says that it has commitments from about 150 grocers in the Bronx to encourage healthy eating habits by prominently featuring nutritious foods like fruits and vegetables near store entrances, while shifting less healthy snacks and drinks to the back; program, part of Bloomberg administration's fight against an obesity epidemic, could eventually be brought to other boroughs.
docs.lead_paragraph: The health department said that it had commitments from about 150 establishments in the area, and that the program could eventually be extended into other boroughs.
docs.snippet: The health department said that it had commitments from about 150 establishments in the area, and that the program could eventually be extended into other boroughs.

headline.main: Medical Costs May Remain High After Weight-Loss Surgery

docs.abstract: A new study suggests that older men who undergo bariatric surgery to lose weight may not see any reductions in medical costs in the years that follow.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that older men who undergo bariatric surgery to lose weight may not see any reductions in medical costs in the years that follow.

docs.abstract: Voluntary physical inactivity, a practice once confined mostly to North America and parts of Europe, is spreading rapidly to the rest of the world and likely contributing materially to global gains in tonnage and declines in health, a group of groundbreaking new reports suggests.

headline.main: Sports Promote Healthy Weight in Teenagers

docs.abstract: Walking or biking to school, or playing on a sports team, or preferably two or more, helped high school students lower their risk of being overweight or obese, according to a new report.
docs.snippet: Walking or biking to school, or playing on a sports team, or preferably two or more, helped high school students lower their risk of being overweight or obese, according to a new report.

headline.print_headline: Keeping Nutritious Dairy Foods in Our Diets
headline.main: Keeping Nutritious Dairy Foods in Our Diets

docs.lead_paragraph: Industry and food product representatives take issue with a column by Mark Bittman.
docs.snippet: Industry and food product representatives take issue with a column by Mark Bittman.
